kac: Ndai langu si i?
translation: Who is this person?

kac: N re.
translation: It is not.

kac: Dai gaw lamung si re.
translation: There is a big house.

kac: Ndai gaw hpa rai?
translation: Is this a question?

kac: Dai gaw ma-un si re.
translation: This is peaceful.

kac: Ma La, kaja ai i?
translation: Are you healthy?

kac: Kaja ai.
translation: It is good.

kac: Ma Lu gaw?
translation: Where are you?

kac: Ngai ya gat sa na.
eng: I am going to the market now.
translation: I am going to the market now.

kac: Hkan na i?
translation: Where is yours?

kac: Um, hkan na.
translation: Breathe deeply.

kac: Hpa baw mari na rai?
eng: What are you going to buy?
translation: What thing did you buy?

kac: Ngai kanau na labu sa mari na.
eng: I am going to buy a longyi for my little sister.
translation: I am going to the shop with my family to buy things.

kac: Ma La, hpa sha na rai?
eng: Ma La, what are you going to eat?
translation: Ma La, what did you eat?

kac: Ngai wa shan shat mai sha na.
eng: I will eat a side dish with pork.
translation: I want to eat chicken dish.

kac: Ma Lu, nang ma wa shan sha na i?
eng: Ma Lu, are you also going to eat pork?
translation: Lu, why didn't you come earlier?

kac: N sha ai.
translation: I have eaten.

kac: Ngai wa shan shat mai n ra ai.
eng: I don't like a side dish with pork.
translation: I also like to eat pork.

kac: Hpa shat mai ra ai rai?
eng: What side dish do you need?
translation: What rice may you eat?

kac: U shan shat mai ra ai.
eng: I will have a side dish with chicken.
translation: Is the chicken still cooking?

kac: Ma La, shat sha ngut sai i?
translation: La, have you finished eating the rice?

kac: Sha ngut sai.
translation: Is the food finished?

kac: N sha shi ai.
translation: I ate the food.

kac: Ngai kaw si taw sai.
translation: I am also here.

kac: Dai hku nga, ngai shat jam jaw sha na yaw.
eng: In that case, I will treat you shat jam.
translation: With this thing, I can't eat only rice.

kac: Kaja i?
translation: Are you good?

kac: Gara kaw ma?
translation: Where?

kac: Manang na Jinghpaw shat seng kaw re.
eng: It is at my friend's Jinghpaw restaurant.
translation: My friend is good at Jinghpaw language.

kac: Grai sha mu ai.
translation: It is very tasty.

kac: Gai, hkan nang wa u yaw.
translation: You, go around and scatter this.

kac: Ngai hpawt de hkawm na.
eng: I will go to travel tomorrow.
translation: Let's meet tomorrow.

kac: Gara de sa na rai?
translation: Which way is it over there?

kac: Manmaw de i?
translation: Is it at Manmaw?

kac: N re. Myitkyina de sa na.
eng: No. I will go to Myitkyina.
translation: I am going to Myitkyina.

kac: Hpa hte sa na rai?
translation: What will you do with it?

kac: Mawdaw hte i?
translation: With a car?

kac: Wan leng hte sa na.
translation: Eating food by the fire.

kac: Wan leng lekmat ma mari ngut sai.
eng: I have already bought a train ticket.
translation: The fire cooled down to some extent but quickly grows again.

kac: Kadai hte sa na rai?
translation: Who wants to eat?

kac: Manang hte i?
translation: A friend?

kac: Nu yen wa hte rau sa na.
eng: I am going with my parents.
translation: Please go with your mother and father.

kac: Ma La na kawa hpa bungli galaw ai rai?
eng: What does Ma La's father do?
translation: Is Mary going to work with your friend?

kac: Jawng kaw sara galaw ai re.
eng: He works as a teacher in a school.
translation: The teacher works at the school.

kac: Na nu gaw hpa galaw ai rai?
translation: What does your mother do?

kac: Gat dut ai.
eng: She sells things at the market.
translation: Went to the market to sell.

kac: Arung arai amyu myu dut ai re.
eng: She sells a lot of stuff.
translation: The person is like a kind of thing.

kac: Gara kaw dut ai rai?
translation: Where are you located?

kac: Hka makau na gat kata kaw re.
eng: At the market near the river.
translation: Your market is near the river.

kac: Anu na seng kaw masha grai sa ai re.
eng: Many people come to my mother's shop.
translation: Anu gets along very well with people.

kac: Ma La, nang kaw Japan laika buk nga ai i?
eng: Ma La, do you have a book about Japan?
translation: Hey La, could you find a book in Japan?

kac: Nga ai.
translation: I said.

kac: Buk kade nga ai rai?
eng: How many books do you have?
translation: How many children are there?

kac: Buk shi daram nga ai.
translation: There are about five books of his.

kac: Grai law ai i.
translation: There were many people.

kac: Ngai kaw gaw langai sha nga ai.
translation: I am fishing in the river.

kac: Gara hku lu la ai rai?
translation: How should it be done by you?

kac: Manang langai Japan kaw na shagun ya ai.
eng: One of my friends sent it to me from Japan.
translation: The friend's child will go to Japan to study.

kac: Nang hti mayu yang ngai ya shap ya na.
eng: I can lend it to you now if you want to read it.
translation: You want to marry, I also hope that.

kac: Ma Lu, dai ni gara de sa mayu ai rai?
eng: Ma Lu, where do you want to go today?
translation: Hey Lu, where do you want to work today?

kac: Ngai dai ni Manau wang de sa mayu ai.
eng: I want to go to Manau plaza today.
translation: I would like to dance at the Manau festival site today.

kac: Ndai kaw na mawdaw hte sa ra ai i?
eng: Do I need to go there by car?
translation: Do you have to eat here with the car?

kac: Mawdaw hte n sa ra ai.
eng: You don't need to go by car.
translation: I intended to go by car.

kac: Dai du hkra nau n tsan ai.
eng: It is not too far to get there.
translation: This thing is far from us.

kac: Lam hkawm mai sa ai.
translation: You may stop on the road.

kac: Rai tim ya ngai lagaw machyi taw ai.
translation: Now my foot is very painful.

kac: Mawdaw hte mai sa na i?
translation: Can you go with the car?

kac: Mai sa ai.
translation: (You) can go.

kac: Dai hku nga mawdaw hte sa ga.
translation: I will go on this road with my car.

kac: Kade jaw ra na rai?
eng: How much do we have to pay?
translation: How much do you have to pay?

kac: Hkying lahkawng daram jaw ra ai.
eng: We have to pay about two thousand kyat.
translation: After a while, (I) have to go on foot.

kac: Kanau, ndai makau kaw lung seng dut ai seng nga ai i?
eng: Brother, is there a shop that sells jade near here?
translation: You won't be able to sell this thing, will you?

kac: Nga ai le.
translation: I said.

kac: Ya lagaw leng pru wa ai shara na makau kaw nga ai.
eng: It is near the place where the bicycle came out just now.
translation: Now, people are riding bicycles all over to return home.

kac: Mu ai i?
translation: Did (you) find (it)?

kac: Um, mu sai, mu sai.
eng: Yes, I see it, I see it.
translation: Oh, very tasty, very tasty.

kac: Dai seng kaw lung seng lahkawn dut ai i?
eng: Does the shop sell a jade bracelet?
translation: Should you read only this book for enjoyment?

kac: Lung seng lahkawn kaba ra ai re.
eng: I want a big jade bracelet.
translation: One can go anywhere to collect things.

kac: Wora seng kaw kaba ai n nga na ngu shadu ai.
eng: I think that shop does not have a big one.
translation: It is very difficult to think about the world.

kac: Kaji ai gaw nga na re.
eng: It surely has a small one.
translation: Grandfather is still young now.

kac: Re i?
translation: Is it?

kac: Hpa rai tim sa yu na re.
translation: What do you want to try to say?

kac: Chyeju kaba sai yaw.
translation: Thank you very much.

kac: N ra ai law.
translation: You like/love.

kac: Ma Naw tauba si la wa ya ai.
eng: Ma Naw brought us a gourd.
translation: Ma Naw has now come to take a gourd fruit.

kac: Tauba si hpe gara hku sha ai rai?
eng: How do you eat a gourd?
translation: Are you able to eat which gourd fruit?

kac: Kawa sha ai baw i?
eng: Do you eat it by biting?
translation: Who is the young man?

kac: N re. Ahpyi sep na sha ai baw re.
eng: No, you eat it by peeling the skin.
translation: I can climb the stairs, but you can't.

kac: Tauba si gaw kangau sha yang grai mu ai.
translation: The gourd fruit is very delicious, and I want to eat it very much.

kac: Sha mayu yang ya kangau ya na le.
eng: I can fry one for you if you want to eat it.
translation: You want to eat this and drink this.

kac: Kangau ngut sai.
translation: The news is over.

kac: Chyim yu u le.
translation: Please let it rain.

kac: Ndai hkri hpa hte kahtawk sha u.
eng: Please eat it with this dipping sauce.
translation: You can ride a bicycle on this road.

kac: Gara hku rai?
translation: Which place is it?

kac: Grai mu ai.
translation: It is very tasty.

kac: Ma Lu, nang Japan sa na wora kaw dut yang kaja ai.
eng: Ma Lu, you had better go to Japan and sell it there.
translation: Mother Lu, do you want to go study in Japan again?

kac: Grai lu dut na re.
translation: You can be very large.

kac: Ngai hpe hkum sharawt tsun.
translation: I must raise (myself) up.

kac: Ma, dai ni jawng n sa ai i?
eng: Child, don't you go to school today?
translation: Mother, will you not go to school that day?

kac: Dai ni jawng pat ai majaw n sa ra ai.
eng: I don't have to go because the school is closed today.
translation: Because today is a school day, I must go again.

kac: Awa ma rung n sa ai i?
eng: Dad, don't you go to the office?
translation: Can the child run too?
